articles.title: Age-Diverse Deepfake Dataset: Bridging the Age Gap in Deepfake Detection
articles.description: arXiv:2508.06552v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The challenges associated with deepfake detection are increasing significantly with the latest advancements in technology and the growing popularity of deepfake videos and images. Despite the presence of numerous detection models, demographic bias in the deepfake dataset remains largely unaddressed. This paper focuses on the mitigation of age-specific bias in the deepfake dataset by introducing an age-diverse deepfake dataset that will improve...
articles.author: Unisha Joshi
articles.content: arXiv:2508.06552v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The challenges associated with deepfake detection are increasing significantly with the latest advancements in technology and the growing popularity of deepfake videos and images. Despite the presence of numerous detection models, demographic bias in the deepfake dataset remains largely unaddressed. This paper focuses on the mitigation of age-specific bias in the deepfake dataset by introducing an age-diverse deepfake dataset that will improve...

articles.title: Recursive Decomposition of Logical Thoughts: Framework for Superior Reasoning and Knowledge Propagation in Large Language Models
articles.description: Background: Large Language Models often struggle with multi-step reasoning due to cascading errors, rigid prompt structures, and underutilized intermediate reasoning steps. While prompting strategies such as Chain-of-Thought , CoT with Self-Consistency, and Least-to-Most offer partial improvements, they typically lack mechanisms for feedback-driven learning or structured reuse of prior thought sequences. Objectives: This work introduces Recursive Decomposition of Logical Thoughts (RDoLT), a...
articles.author: Kaleem Ullah Qasim, Jiashu Zhang, Tariq Alsahfi, Ateeq Ur Rehman Butt
articles.content: Background: Large Language Models often struggle with multi-step reasoning due to cascading errors, rigid prompt structures, and underutilized intermediate reasoning steps. While prompting strategies such as Chain-of-Thought , CoT with Self-Consistency, and Least-to-Most offer partial improvements, they typically lack mechanisms for feedback-driven learning or structured reuse of prior thought sequences. Objectives: This work introduces Recursive Decomposition of Logical Thoughts (RDoLT), a...

articles.title: Questing for the quantum AI advantage
articles.description: Two quantum experts disclose high hopes and realities for the emerging space The clock is ticking down to the realization of quantum AI and the sought-after “quantum advantage.” In many boardrooms, however, quantum remains mysterious: full of promise, but not fully understood. Still, desire to profit from being first on the scene... The post Questing for the quantum AI advantage first appeared on AI-Tech Park.

articles.title: OpenAI Launches GPT-5, the Next Step in Its Quest for AGI
articles.description: The wait is finally over. Today, right now, OpenAI is releasing its latest and greatest large language model, GPT-5, and making it available through the ChatGPT interface. According to OpenAI’s leaders, the model brings unprecedented powers of reasoning, brings vibe coding to a new level, is better than ever at agentic AI tasks, and comes with a raft of new safety features. “It’s a significant step along the path of AGI,” said OpenAI CEO Sam Altman at a press briefing yesterday, referring to...
articles.author: Eliza Strickland
articles.content: The wait is finally over. Today, right now, OpenAI is releasing its latest and greatest large language model, GPT-5, and making it available through the ChatGPT interface. According to OpenAI’s leaders, the model brings unprecedented powers of reasoning, brings vibe coding to a new level, is better than ever at agentic AI tasks, and comes with a raft of new safety features. “It’s a significant step along the path of AGI,” said OpenAI CEO Sam Altman at a press briefing yesterday, referring to...

articles.title: New Report: The Architectural Patterns of Financial AI
articles.description: At Bankwell Bank, a new employee named Sarah works around the clock. She responds to loan applicants via email and SMS in under three minutes, gathers missing documents, and hands a perfectly structured file to her human colleagues. She has re-activated roughly half of the bank’s otherwise lost applicants and saved loan officers 90% ofContinue reading "New Report: The Architectural Patterns of Financial AI" The post New Report: The Architectural Patterns of Financial AI appeared first on...

articles.title: Building a Transformer Model for Language Translation
articles.description: This post is divided into six parts; they are: • Why Transformer is Better than Seq2Seq • Data Preparation and Tokenization • Design of a Transformer Model • Building the Transformer Model • Causal Mask and Padding Mask • Training and Evaluation Traditional seq2seq models with recurrent neural networks have two main limitations: • Sequential processing prevents parallelization • Limited ability to capture long-term dependencies since hidden states are overwritten whenever an element is...
articles.author: Adrian Tam
articles.content: This post is divided into six parts; they are: • Why Transformer is Better than Seq2Seq • Data Preparation and Tokenization • Design of a Transformer Model • Building the Transformer Model • Causal Mask and Padding Mask • Training and Evaluation Traditional seq2seq models with recurrent neural networks have two main limitations: • Sequential processing prevents parallelization • Limited ability to capture long-term dependencies since hidden states are overwritten whenever an element is...

articles.title: BigTokDetect: A Clinically-Informed Vision-Language Model Framework for Detecting Pro-Bigorexia Videos on TikTok
articles.description: arXiv:2508.06515v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Social media platforms increasingly struggle to detect harmful content that promotes muscle dysmorphic behaviors, particularly pro-bigorexia content that disproportionately affects adolescent males. Unlike traditional eating disorder detection focused on the "thin ideal," pro-bigorexia material masquerades as legitimate fitness content through complex multimodal combinations of visual displays, coded language, and motivational messaging that evade...

articles.title: A Federated Learning Framework for Handling Subtype Confounding and Heterogeneity in Large-Scale Neuroimaging Diagnosis
articles.description: arXiv:2508.06589v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Computer-aided diagnosis (CAD) systems play a crucial role in analyzing neuroimaging data for neurological and psychiatric disorders. However, small-sample studies suffer from low reproducibility, while large-scale datasets introduce confounding heterogeneity due to multiple disease subtypes being labeled under a single category. To address these challenges, we propose a novel federated learning framework tailored for neuroimaging CAD systems. Our...
articles.author: Xinglin Zhao, Yanwen Wang, Xiaobo Liu, Yanrong Hao, Rui Cao, Xin Wen
articles.content: arXiv:2508.06589v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Computer-aided diagnosis (CAD) systems play a crucial role in analyzing neuroimaging data for neurological and psychiatric disorders. However, small-sample studies suffer from low reproducibility, while large-scale datasets introduce confounding heterogeneity due to multiple disease subtypes being labeled under a single category. To address these challenges, we propose a novel federated learning framework tailored for neuroimaging CAD systems. Our...

While many spatio-temporal methods focus on improving accuracy, fairness has recently gained attention due to growing evidence that biased predictions in spatio-temporal...

articles.title: Semi-automated Fact-checking in Portuguese: Corpora Enrichment using Retrieval with Claim extraction
articles.description: arXiv:2508.06495v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The accelerated dissemination of disinformation often outpaces the capacity for manual fact-checking, highlighting the urgent need for Semi-Automated Fact-Checking (SAFC) systems. Within the Portuguese language context, there is a noted scarcity of publicly available datasets that integrate external evidence, an essential component for developing robust AFC systems, as many existing resources focus solely on classification based on intrinsic text...
articles.author: Juliana Resplande Sant'anna Gomes, Arlindo Rodrigues Galv\~ao Filho
articles.content: arXiv:2508.06495v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The accelerated dissemination of disinformation often outpaces the capacity for manual fact-checking, highlighting the urgent need for Semi-Automated Fact-Checking (SAFC) systems. articles.title: Semi-Supervised Supply Chain Fraud Detection with Unsupervised Pre-Filtering
articles.description: arXiv:2508.06574v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Detecting fraud in modern supply chains is a growing challenge, driven by the complexity of global networks and the scarcity of labeled data. Traditional detection methods often struggle with class imbalance and limited supervision, reducing their effectiveness in real-world applications. This paper proposes a novel two-phase learning framework to address these challenges. In the first phase, the Isolation Forest algorithm performs unsupervised...
articles.author: Fatemeh Moradi, Mehran Tarif, Mohammadhossein Homaei
articles.content: arXiv:2508.06574v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Detecting fraud in modern supply chains is a growing challenge, driven by the complexity of global networks and the scarcity of labeled data. Traditional detection methods often struggle with class imbalance and limited supervision, reducing their effectiveness in real-world applications. This paper proposes a novel two-phase learning framework to address these challenges. In the first phase, the Isolation Forest algorithm performs unsupervised...

articles.title: Retrieval augmented generation based dynamic prompting for few-shot biomedical named entity recognition using large language models
articles.description: arXiv:2508.06504v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Biomedical named entity recognition (NER) is a high-utility natural language processing (NLP) task, and large language models (LLMs) show promise particularly in few-shot settings (i.e., limited training data). In this article, we address the performance challenges of LLMs for few-shot biomedical NER by investigating a dynamic prompting strategy involving retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). In our approach, the annotated in-context learning...
articles.author: Yao Ge, Sudeshna Das, Yuting Guo, Abeed Sarker
articles.content: arXiv:2508.06504v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Biomedical named entity recognition (NER) is a high-utility natural language processing (NLP) task, and large language models (LLMs) show promise particularly in few-shot settings (i.e., limited training data). In this article, we address the performance challenges of LLMs for few-shot biomedical NER by investigating a dynamic prompting strategy involving retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). In our approach, the annotated in-context learning...

articles.title: CarbonScaling: Extending Neural Scaling Laws for Carbon Footprint in Large Language Models
articles.description: arXiv:2508.06524v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Neural scaling laws have driven the development of increasingly large language models (LLMs) by linking accuracy improvements to growth in parameter count, dataset size, and compute. However, these laws overlook the carbon emissions that scale exponentially with LLM size. This paper presents \textit{CarbonScaling}, an analytical framework that extends neural scaling laws to incorporate both operational and embodied carbon in LLM training. By...
articles.author: Lei Jiang, Fan Chen
articles.content: arXiv:2508.06524v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Neural scaling laws have driven the development of increasingly large language models (LLMs) by linking accuracy improvements to growth in parameter count, dataset size, and compute. However, these laws overlook the carbon emissions that scale exponentially with LLM size. This paper presents \textit{CarbonScaling}, an analytical framework that extends neural scaling laws to incorporate both operational and embodied carbon in LLM training. By...

articles.title: Slice or the Whole Pie? Utility Control for AI Models
articles.description: arXiv:2508.06551v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Training deep neural networks (DNNs) has become an increasingly resource-intensive task, requiring large volumes of labeled data, substantial computational power, and considerable fine-tuning efforts to achieve optimal performance across diverse use cases. Although pre-trained models offer a useful starting point, adapting them to meet specific user needs often demands extensive customization, and infrastructure overhead. This challenge grows when...
articles.author: Ye Tao

Although pre-trained models offer a useful starting point, adapting them to meet specific user needs often demands extensive customization, and infrastructure overhead. This challenge grows when...
